title: Evaluation of the Antimicrobial Effect of Eucalyptus (Eucalyptus camaldulensis Dehnh.) and Jalape√±o Pepper (Capsicum annuum cv.) extracts by CLSM and AFM
content: Extracts of natural origin obtained from various plants and vegetables contain a wide variety of bioactive compounds that are of utmost importance because they possess important biological activities such as antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, cardioprotective, antimicrobial, and anticancer properties [9]. Bioactive compounds are mostly secondary plant metabolites that can be mainly classified into phenolic compounds, terpenes, alkaloids, pigments, among others [10]. Phenolic compounds stand out for providing quality attributes such as flavor, appearance, and other organoleptic properties; however, their importance lies in the fact that they have antioxidant effects and contribute to antimicrobial activity [2].
